Major PCB makers in Thailand also reported no disruption. Zhen Ding Tech said its Prachinburi facility was unaffected and running as usual. Compeq confirmed brief evacuations but no operational issues. Unimicron was not impacted due to its distance from the epicenter. Thai Lin confirmed full operational continuity and employee safety.

Asia Optical stated that its Yangon site in southern Myanmar and its northern Myanmar subcontracted plants, all single-story structures, were unaffected. Its subsidiary, Asia Tech Imaging, confirmed no issues. Contract manufacturer Kinpo said its Thai production lines were operating normally with no injuries or construction delays.

Title: European Commission: 1.3 billion euros to finance pr ...
Description:
The European Commission announced last Friday the last section of funding of its digital program, which plans to invest 1.3 billion euros in the next two years.

All tech news for pros every day in our newsletter learn more about the use of personal data

This last program's investment tranche, launched in 2021 for a total investment of 7.6 billion euros, will be focused on several priorities defined by the European Commission.

AI and virtual worlds

Unsurprisingly, the program is no exception to the global craze for artificial intelligence technologies. The funding allocated by the Commission will be used to "improve the availability and accessibility of generative AI applications, including in the health and care sectors."

More surprisingly, the Commission also evokes the possibility of testing "immersive environments, called virtual worlds". Behind this term, the commission does not really speak of finance a new MMORPG but rather virtual test platforms. These platforms which mobilize technologies of the digital twin type will be mainly planned for the fields of manufacture, construction or industrial manufacturing, as well as in the field of health or education.

The Commission is ready to finance at 20 million euros two prototypes in these various fields, which will allow a first implementation of these technologies and to more clearly define the use cases and associated services.

In parallel, the plan plans to reserve part of its funds on the initiative Destination Earth, which aims to model a digital twin of the land for researchers who work on global warming, forecasting natural disasters or climate.

Do not forget the cyber

The funding released will also go to the cybersecurity sector, in particular in order to finance initiatives orchestrated by ENISA in the support of cybersecurity of hospitals and health establishments across the European Union.

Part of the funds will also be allocated to the protection of submarine cables, an essential digital infrastructure recently shaken by several cases of cable ruptures after the intervention of foreign ships.

The funding planned through this plan will result in several calls for projects which will be presented from April on a dedicated platform, and during the rest of the year.

Title: A world without password arrives at Microsoft for Outlook, XB ...
Description:
Microsoft reviews its connection screens to facilitate authentication of your account using Passkeys and other methods without password. In a blog post published last Wednesday, Robin Goldstein, director of Microsoft Identity, said that the new connection process will appear in Outlook, Xbox, Windows and Microsoft 365, among other services.

All tech news for pros every day in our newsletter learn more about the use of personal data

The new screens have already appeared, starting with Xbox last month. The deployment will continue until the end of April.

On this date, the more than 3 billion Microsoft users worldwide should see the new procedure when they connect to Windows on their PC and Microsoft platforms on the web.

Rationalization of the authentication user interface

One of the main objectives of the new process is to help users more easily use options, such as passkeys, facial recognition and fingerprint scans.

The current session opening screens always focus on passwords as a default session opening method. A change was essential.

"The rationalization of the design of the UX [User Experience] of authentication has enabled us to rethink the default experiences for the opening of session, by emphasizing the conviviality and security," said Goldstein. "In recent years, we have introduced several improvements, including the possibility of completely deleting the password from your account and the management of key authentication instead of using a password. Our new user interface is optimized for an experience without password and with connection keys first.

The new experience begins with the registration process

If you register for a Microsoft service with an existing email address, you will not be invited to create a password. Instead, you will receive by email a single -use security code that you will need to check for access.

Once connected, you will be invited to create a password. If you do, your password will become the default connection option as far as possible.

"By providing your own email address to a new Microsoft account, you don't need to create a new Microsoft password that could be easily forgotten or guessed by an attacker," said Goldstein. "You just have to check the email using a single use code, which becomes the default identifier of your new account, so that you start without password. In addition, you now have an email address associated with your account if you need to recover your account or start using a new device.

Microsoft also reorganizes the flow of connection screens. Depending on how you are currently logging in, you can face several screens, each with their own choices. This can make the experience too complex and bulky. The new process promises to reorganize the screens more intuitively and to simplify each of them so that they are more fluid.

FLUENT DESIGN Aesthetic

The next step concerns the appearance and conviviality of the new session opening screens. Microsoft repainted them with its full design aesthetics, which gives them a more rationalized and uniform appearance. The screens are more centered to help you focus on them without distraction. In addition, they were optimized to display themselves correctly on all supports, from the small mobile phone to the big desk screen.

One of the features most requested by users is the management of a dark theme. You can choose a clear or dark theme depending on your preferences. The theme of your choice will be automatically activated each time you log in.

I tested the new connection screen with Xbox, and the connection experience is improved. I generally use an authentication application to check my Microsoft account. The new experience improves this method but also offers other types of authentication without password.

How to try the new process now

Web and mobile applications will be the first to adopt new screens. Windows support and Windows applications will follow.

To familiarize yourself with the new process, try it on the Xbox website.

Otherwise, wait until the end of April and you can see how it works in all areas.

Title: An e-commerce function arrives in France on Tiktok
Description:
Tiktok opens an online store on the French version of its platform mentions Les Echos. The novelty in relation to competition is the possibility for the customer to make the purchase completely inside the application. And this where Instagram for example uses outgoing links. Reducing this friction should allow Tiktok to increase the social trade conversion rate.

All tech news for pros every day in our newsletter learn more about the use of personal data

Tiktok also promises advertisers to precisely measure the number of clicks and sales generated by their advertising investments.

According to a study, 62 % of Millennials are more likely to become loyal customers of brands who interact with them on social networks.

Meta's previous ones

E-merchants must now prepare for a new dynamic in terms of advertising and marketing. In addition to traditional platforms like Google and Amazon, social networks like Tiktok and Meta offer opportunities to reach consumers ready to buy without leaving the application.

The fact remains that this Tiktok initiative is not a first in the world of social networks.

The Marketplace features of Facebook (2016) and Instagram Shop (2018) have been present in the French landscape for years, without having upset the world of e-commerce. The fact remains that shopping is one more lever in the world of social networks, whose queen metric is time of attention.

Amazon has become a king of advertising

Meta and Tiktok's strategies in terms of e-commerce also aim to compete with Amazon, which has become a major player in retail media and online advertising.

Amazon is now the third largest world actor in digital advertising, behind Google and Meta.

Title: Société Générale is recruiting the ex-CDO of L’Oréal and Alexis Kohler
Description:
Large maneuvers are not completed in the Société Générale group two years after the arrival of Slawomir Krupa as managing director. The boss notably cut drastically in expenses, including IT.

All tech news for pros every day in our newsletter learn more about the use of personal data

Slawomir Krupa intends to transform the bank. And to continue his strategy, he will be assisted by two new executives in a few months.

Société Générale has formalized the appointment of Lubomira Rochet and Alexis Kohler.

Key technology skills

For the past three years a partner of an investment company in London, Lubomira Rochet has been the Chief Digital Officer of the World Cosmetics Giant for more than seven years: L’Oréal. It is largely for her technological skills that she is recruited.

As of April, Lubomira Rochet will occupy the function of deputy director general. Its portfolio is wide since it includes retail banking activities in France, private banking and insurance and operations (technology, purchasing, real estate).

Member of the executive committee of the financial group, the manager will be responsible for supporting Slawomir Krupa on this perimeter. In its press release, Société Générale insists in particular on its experience of transformation, digital and customer relations.

From the Élysée to the presidency of the investment bank

"His skills in technology, his in -depth experience, his strategic vision and his leadership will be key assets in the continuation of the development and transformation of the group and our retail activities in France", underlines the bank.

The banking group will also welcome a defector from the political world and 2nd figure in French political life: the former general general of the Élysée Alexis Kohler. His new career will start in June 2025 as a member of the Executive Committee and Deputy Managing Director of the group.

From Emmanuel Macron, Alexis Kohler goes to Slawomir Krupa, to whom he is attached. His missions concern the investment bank, of which he becomes the president. Fusing activities & acquisitions, equity capital market and acquisition funding are its responsibility.

"Multiple qualities" hailed by Slawomir Krupa

"Its multiple qualities will be major assets to contribute to the development of our investment bank and the continuation of the transformation of the company," says Société Générale.

In addition to his functions as secretary general of the Presidency of the Republic since 2017, Alexis Kohler has held various positions at the Ministry of the Economy and Finance, with the International Monetary Fund and the World Bank, as well as the MSC financial management.

It is for past and family ties to the MSC shipowner that Alexis Kohler was indicted by the justice for illegal interest. Its name is also quoted in the scandal of bottled water from Nestlé and for the slippage of public accounts.

Title: 41% of brands use AI for their videos
Description:
Artificial intelligence is everywhere and you have to be very naive to think the opposite today. In terms of marketing, IA tools and features transform the market and it is almost difficult to do without to create when it comes to creating content. By analyzing 14 million videos and by questioning 1,100 marketing professionals, the trend described by Wistia in its report "State of Video 2025" is clear and it is not a simple fashion effect.

Video production is complex work. So when tools automatize time -on tasks and reduce costs while retaining a qualitative rendering, they are welcome.

Concretely, AI is used as a preproduction for writing scenario and the search for ideas as well as postproduction. This results in an increase of 572% of the use of artificial intelligence for the drafting of legends and subtitles since 2021. In short, more than 60% of respondents use or plan to use AI in this way. Without forgetting that AI is also widely used for vocal dubbing (38%) and translation (31%).

According to data published by Wistia, short videos and tutorials are the content that perform the most. Clips under 60 seconds display the highest engagement rates; Reaching 82% while longer videos (5 to 30 minutes) have 58%. Finally, call-to-action on content of less than a minute allow to convert around 40% of spectators.

Although more and more present, artificial intelligence does not sound the end of the video. The market is doing well and moults, since 57% of companies increase their video budget, compared to 5% that reduce it.

Title: Good marketing based on illustrations with GPT 4O: because L ...
Description:
It's fouuuuuuuuuuuuuuu! This is undoubtedly one of the best innovations in this year AI! OPENAI has just published the native generation of images with GPT-4O. And this thing changes the situation. 🤣 To the point that the servers of Openai have struggled to manage the workload for a few days.

Receive a selection of strategic advice and concrete tips every week in your mailbox with our newsletter practical guides. Learn more about the use of personal data

On the professional side, you do not need professional skills in terms of design, overpriced software, or even an ounce of artistic talent to produce breathtaking visuals. All you need is your imagination.

Yes because our imagination will soon become the greatest limit of AI. Each new announcement concerning AI clearly shows that creators and marketing specialists are winners. The AI ​​continues to drop the barriers to the entrance into almost all areas. You don't know how to code? There is an AI for this. No design skills? There is an AI for that too. 🤯

In this article, I will explain to you what exactly this novelty means for marketing professionals, and how the generation of images works.

What has changed and why is important

Before getting to the heart of the matter, allow me to give you an accelerated course on the generation of images.

The generation of images uses a machine learning technique. The idea is to take existing images, and gradually add noise. The model then trains by reversing the process, by learning to remove the noise step by step until it can rebuild an image from purely random elements. While learning, the model receives label that describe each image, like "a cat that plays", which helps him associate the text with visual patterns.

Once trained, if you type new words like "a red car", the model begins with a rough image and the refines so that it corresponds to the description.🤓

At the time, and by time, I mean a few months ago, the generation of images was useful, but unfinished. Even when the results were satisfactory, graphics skills were generally necessary to correct imperfections.

Above all, it was frustrating because the result changed completely when you grabbed again a quick. And it made it difficult to iteration and improvement. In addition, the addition of text to an image was almost impossible. The fonts looked like hieroglyphs, the words seemed invented and the text was often vague. In short, it was a real waste. 😖

Today, with this chatgpt update, you can quickly iterate and the vague text is no longer a problem. Of course, it also has some improvements, such as being faster than other tools and operating directly in Chatgpt.

And so far, I am very, very, very impressed. The power that this update gives to professionals who are not graphic designers is unrivaled. No need to wait until someone else gives life to your vision; You can just get started. 😑

Oh, and I didn't have to pay more to access these features. They are included in the Pro Subscription (and more). In short, you can now create freely using natural language. Instead of Adobe, I am very worried about the turn that events will take in the near future.

How to use AI as part of your digital marketing activity

I will show you exactly how to go from the idea to the launch of the campaign using Chatgpt. If you are blocked or if you're not sure of a step, guess what? Just ask Chatgpt, lol. 🤪

Step 1 - The idea and the concept

I decided to create a line of skin care products. This idea corresponded to several criteria. It has a strong potential for customer loyalty and solves a problem that allows me to create a faithful community.

I called her "salt", that is to say "them" upside down. For what ? Because I'm chic. 💁‍♂️

Step 2 - Product design

Now that we have a solid concept, let's work on design. Salt is a luxury product, so it must naturally be up to par. Here is the exact prompt I used to create the salt brand image:

"Create a realistic product, studio quality, a luxury skin care brand called" salt ". Design the product packaging in the form of an elegant rectangular bottle with a burned orange matt finish, accompanied by a matching rectangular box. The bottle and the box must present a minimalist and sophisticated brand image, with the" Salt "text in an elegant and modern fate Using a black typography. Homogeneous matching the burned orange color of the packaging.

And here are the results:

Salt Image of the product. Lester MAPP via Chatgpt

I bet it caught your attention. Let's continue. 🤗

Step 3 - Manufacturing

Once the idea and the design is fixed, it is time to take action and have salt made. Using Chatgpt Operator (only in the United States for the moment), I have generated a list of national skin care products manufacturers. 🏭

Here is the pormpt I used:

"Identify a precise and up-to-date list of 5 renowned national manufacturers of skin care products in the United States, specialized exclusively in luxury skin care products. Concentrate specifically on manufacturers that offer high-end packaging options, customizable formulations emphasizing botanical and natural ingredients, and experienced experience in the production of serums, hydrating creamers Treatment.

Once I have my list, I can use Operator to contact these manufacturers for me. 🤞

Step 4 - Design a website

It's time to create the website. I would not use Chatgpt to create a site from zero while Shopify exists. However, I want a personalized theme to stand out.

For this next step, I will ask Chatgpt to offer me some model ideas so that I can adapt the theme of Shopify to my taste.

Lester MAPP via Chatgpt

Step 5 - Marketing campaign

Thanks to Chatgpt, I can develop a marketing concept and an advertising creation.

Here is the concept:

Salt marketing campaign. Lester MAPP via Chatgpt

Here is the text of the announcement I found for my campaign. 🚀

"Sel By holds them hydration and leaves the skin radiant, smooth and nourished. Take pleasure today and enjoy free delivery the same day".

Step 6 - Sales team

But why stop on online sale? salt should be in store. Thanks to Chatgpt Operator, I can ask the AI ​​to compile a list of large areas in my region.

With this list, I can then use AI to help I write professional quality emails to attract the attention of buyers. I can ask Operator to help me in my efforts by giving it access to my email and the list of my contacts. Thus, AI can help us find an idea and market it. 📈

Yes, you will understand, this update is much more important than the simple fact of doing Ghibli art!

Here is why this update is important

Jeff Bezos said one day: "Our success at Amazon depends on the number of experiences we have per year, per month, per week, per day".

Before these innovations, a considerable budget and team needed to obtain the same results. Not only does the AI ​​fills the gap in terms of budget and team size, but it also fills another ditch which people do not even speak yet ... that of time.

It is a question of posting the limits of the possible while achieving the impossible quickly. 🤑 As I said before, the real limit to the success of AI could be our imagination, not the AI ​​itself.

Limitations and concerns

Although I am enthusiastic by GPT-4O and everything he can do, he is not perfect.

Even if the images are incredible and represent gigantic progress, they are not always accurate. AI can sometimes get confused, especially when it comes to detailed requests. Although it is much better than before, we have not yet reached the status of instant masterpieces.

Another element to take into account is originality. GPT-4O creates images on the basis of existing data, so that similar images may appear. You will always need the human touch to create really unique content. 😔

Finally, there is of course a huge problem. Who does this work belong to? As the images generated by AI become more common, it will be more and more complicated to know who holds the rights of creation or how to recognize the original human creators that these AI models have learned the work. We urgently need clear rules on this point. It is essential to determine the appropriate legislation and safeguards 🫠

Title: Almost one in two French people live with a "problem" smartphone
Description:
All smartphone users have experienced it. After a few years or even a few months, a mobile phone gives signs of failure. 42 % of French people thus live with a dysfunctional smartphone, according to a study by Télécom Paris, digital limits, the University of Toulouse and Vinci Research Center.

All tech news for pros every day in our newsletter learn more about the use of personal data

The most frequent problems are:

Degraded battery (28 % of users)

Saturation of the storage space (23 %)

Unusual slowness (21 %)

Update problems then come to 12 % of people surveyed

If the three -year -old milestone is often quoted as a diffile passage, problems sometimes appear earlier. For half of the users, they intervene in the year of obtaining the smartphone and a quarter during the second year.

Dysfunctions that last for months or even years

Without being able to ensure the financial cost of a repair or replacement of such an expensive device - high -end models exceed the thousand euros mark -, the French must deal with dysfunctions that harm their user experience.

According to the study, problems often last more than 6 months (68 %), or even more than 2 years (36 %), even if they are considered rather annoying (47 %) or very annoying (35 %). Powerless, only 43 % tried to resolve them for themselves and more than half (58 %) of attempted resolution failed.

"The replacement of the smartphone is more often motivated by the frustration linked to the accumulation of hardware and software dysfunctions on the device than by a real inability to use," note the authors. As the phone is finally replaced, it is completely unusable in only 14.7 % of cases.

Problems above all software

While the emphasis is often placed on the most visible causes, of the broken screen or failing battery, these material problems, which can be resolved by maintenance, repair or replacement of the defective component, represent only 40 % of the cases encountered.

Most of the problems (60 %) are therefore of software origin. These can be features that no longer work, applications that bug or do not open, updates to the operating system that has become impossible. These software dysfunctions can affect WiFi, GPS, camera or even telephone calls and sending SMS.

Smartphones brands can organize the accelerated renewal of their models. A few years ago, Apple was attacked for planned obsolescence. The apple firm was accused of knowingly slowing down old iPhones during iOS updates or complicating the repair or replacement of components.

Less delicious applications, reinforced repairability

Based on these findings, the authors of the study issues several recommendations to extend the lifespan of our smartphone. They recommend that smartphones manufacturers provide a software guarantee "and this, over several years. »»

The provision of lighter applications and less consuming data would limit the risk of saturation of storage, would preserve the battery and avoid the slowness of slowness. It is a question of facilitating the management of the storage by the user and of "making intelligible the data produced by the applications".

The study also offers "adding parameters that make it possible to bypass dysfunctions and preserve the battery. In addition, it is necessary to facilitate the repairability of the smartphone. This presupposes from manufacturers and publishers to design equipment and software that the user can repair and maintain yourself.

Finally, the authors offer to extend the repair bonus to solving software problem. For the time being, this state aid only concerns the accidental breakage of a smartphone screen, or replacing the battery, the speaker, the microphone or the photo lens.

Title: App TransParency: Apple sanctioned in France of an Amen ...
Description:
Apple was sanctioned Monday by the French Competition Authority for a fine of 150 million euros mentions Reuters.

All tech news for pros every day in our newsletter learn more about the use of personal data

In question, a competitive imbalance created by Apple, which requires confidentiality conditions, via its tool "App Tracking Transparency" (ATT). Conditions that benefit from its own services compared to those of applications of applications and advertising service providers.

This decision comes after an investigation into the company's practices between April 2021 and July 2023, the period during which Apple was accused of abusing its dominant position on the mobile applications market for iOS and iPados.

A victory for mobile application developers

The authority specifies that the intention behind ATT, aimed at protecting the personal data of users, is laudable. But that its implementation is neither necessary nor proportionate compared to the displayed objective.

As a result, mobile application developers could see their advertising revenue assigned by these restrictions imposed by Apple, thus limiting their ability to monetize their products effectively.

The system has notably attracted criticism from several French associations of online advertising professionals. They had filed a complaint in 2020 against the device deployed by Apple. According to its complainants, the authority judged the practices of the company were deemed too restrictive, thus distorting competition.

Necessary to protect the privacy of its users

In addition, ATT is also under investigation in Germany. The competition authority of this country accused Apple, in February, of taking preferential treatment via this tool.

Apple for its part defends a tool that it considers necessary to protect the privacy of its users. But also impose high standards for data protection on its ecosystem.

Establishment in 2021, App Tracking Transparency is a functionality which makes it possible to impose on an application to harvest the consent of the user before collecting the data. And this while offering the user a more detailed overview of the data recovered by each application.

Title: Apple: the 6 characteristics that will define the folding iPhone
Description:
The folding iPhone, which we have been talking about for about 10 years, could finally be released next year.

All tech news for pros every day in our newsletter learn more about the use of personal data

According to a recent MacRumors analysis, which has gathered all the information available on this subject, six major features are to be expected for this future model.

1. A fold screen

Apple would have invested massively to minimize the folding brand on the screen.

A combination of technologies applied to the hinge and the slab would provide a surface as smooth as possible.

2. A book format inspired by the Galaxy Z Fold

Apple would have explored different conceptions before deciding.

If some rumors mentioned a valve model, similar to the Samsung Galaxy Z Flip, recent information suggests that the foldable iPhone will rather adopt a design that opens like a book, like the Galaxy Z Fold.

3. A software redesign for iOS

The iPhone operating system was not originally designed for use in landscape mode.

A software update is therefore necessary to adapt to folding screens.

Apple would work on this overhaul, notably iOS 19, iPados 19 and MacOS 16, in order to bring greater coherence to the whole.

4. Dimensions close to the iPad Mini

The device, once closed, would offer an external 5.5 inch screen, more compact than current models.

Unfolded, he would reach 7.8 inches, approaching the format of the iPad Mini.

5. Record finesse of 4.8 mm

Apple intends to integrate on this folding iPhone, the technology of the iPhone 17 Air, its future ultra-fine model expected this fall.

Once open, the device could thus reach a thickness of only 4.8 mm, even thinner than the iPad Pro, currently the thinnest product in Apple.

On the other hand, when it is folded, its thickness would be between 9 mm and 9.5 mm.

6. Touch ID replaces Face ID

According to analyst Ming-Chi Kuo, Apple could replace Face ID with a Touch ID sensor integrated into the power button.

This choice would be dictated by thickness stresses: if Apple cannot sufficiently refine the TrueDepth camera module, Touch ID would become the privileged solution.

Title: With Autosur and Intersport, the black series of data leaks ...
Description:
Last week, the Cybermalvence Public Interest Group reported its fears after a year 2024 black in terms of data leaks. Unfortunately, nothing indicates that this trend is about to stop, proof with two new deplored hacks.

All tech news for pros every day in our newsletter learn more about the use of personal data

The group specializing in Autosur technical control has just deplored "a security incident involving unauthorized access to certain data".

Result: a massive data leak, with unknown origins, which concerns around 4 million customers, said a company spokesperson at BFM TV.

Reinforced defenses

The data that leaked relate to the first name, last name, email and postal addresses, telephone number, and the customer license plate number. The company recalls that it does not have banking data, information which cannot therefore be concerned.

"All necessary measures have been taken immediately to put an end to this incident and strengthen the protection of our information systems," also added Autosur.

The company also recalls having, as provided for by the regulations, notified the CNIL of the data violation. Likewise, a judicial complaint has been filed.

Assistance requests

In addition to Autosur, the Intersport sports brand also reported at the end of last week to RTL that it had been the victim of a computer intrusion during the weekend of March 15 to 16. On the BreachForums data leak forum, a surfer had sold a database for a few days later. It gathered data on just over 3.3 million customers of the brand, of which, he said, Paypal payment information.

So many stolen information that can be used, generally recalled cybermalveht, to targeted scams, attempts at phishing or accounts.

Last year, the public interest group had found a sharp increase in assistance requests, probably in connection with the "many violations of massive personal data" and the "important and permanent SMS waves or mail of any type" deplored.

Title: Career: 5 secrets to achieve your professional goals ...
Description:
The Harvard Business Review suggests that professional objectives are notoriously difficult to achieve.

Receive a selection of strategic advice and concrete tips every week in your mailbox with our newsletter practical guides. Learn more about the use of personal data

For what ? Because if the effort to be provided is greater than the perceived reward, we are tempted to abandon our objectives.

So, how can you reverse the situation and achieve your professional and personal goals? Five business leaders gave us their advice.

1. Create objectives that you can manage

Bev White, CEO of Nash Squared, says that professionals who want to set significant objectives should know what they want to achieve. "This is what I call understanding her why and his raison d'être," she said. "Once you are clear on these points, think about what will help you get there and set your goals."

Ms. White tells ZDNET that it is essential that professionals divide the long -term objectives into elements they can manage. "The objective of a person can be the ascent of Kilimandjaro. But there are many stages on the path that leads to this destination: training, physical condition, equipment, logistics, planning, travel" she says. "You must therefore decompose your large objective into constituent elements and get down to it". Ms. White also says that professionals must be realistic about their objectives. "If it appears that a goal is not achievable, do not be afraid to change course. It is part of the learning and development process."

Besides, if you stick to your goal, don't forget to celebrate the little successes that mark your journey. "This maintains your motivation and encourages you to continue," she adds. "It is also useful to share your goals with a mentor or a person you know and in whom you trust, because it makes the goal more concrete. This person can encourage you and share with you the celebration of your little successes throughout your journey."

2. Accept your naivety

Chris Kronenthal, DT of Freedompay, encourages professionals to start naively and prepare to become as practical as possible. "You need this naivety," he said. Mr. Kronenthal gives ZDNET the example of entrepreneurs who launch an innovative business. Most start-ups fail. But statistical probabilities should not prevent you from continuing your dream, whether it is to reach the top of your profession or create a prosperous business.

"It will be difficult. But to take the first step, you have to be naive and believe that we will be this 1 % that will succeed." According to Mr. Kronienthal, there are two essential success factors to achieve his personal goals. "The first is a mentor. And it is not someone who just spends time with you during your free time. It is someone who is critically committed to your development and who has already done it before," he said.

"Second, achieving your personal goals takes longer than you think. You should think that your success is only a matter of time."

3. Collect with other people

Jeff Palmiero, technical VP at Raymond James, says that to achieve its objectives, you have to be tireless.

"I always try to approach perfection as much as possible," he said. And he cites as an example how he uses dashboards of his observability platform to verify the performance of business applications. "Each indicator should not necessarily be green. But when we encounter problems, I want people to work with developers to reach perfection."

Palmiero explains to ZDNET that collaboration with people outside your service can help you achieve your goals, which it notes when it sets objectives. "Perhaps the result of these discussions is that 800 milliseconds is the best response time than because of the nature of what should happen during a process," he said.

4. Push the limits

Madoc Bathers, Cloud manager at Warner Leisure Hotels, believes that courage is the keyword. "It takes determination. I practice a lot of substantive race, which allows me to train to set goals outside work. This gave me a state of mind that allows me to overcome obstacles. I must continue to push the limits".

Mr. Batters explains to ZDNET that it is essential to listen to the advice advice. But you also have to have self -confidence. "You have to take it into account. But if they are part of the decision-making process, you are also part of it," he explains.

Mr. Batters also encourages professionals to put into perspective. "Try to take a step back from the current situation and understand how a decision affects the future".

5. Build a network

According to Cynthia Stoddard, Adobe's computer director, to set and achieve personal goals, you have to stay open to new challenges. "A few days ago, I participated in a round table in France and a question was asked:" Did you intend to become DSI? "It was not the case," she said. "The way I touched my career was to examine different opportunities, get out of my comfort zone and try new things."

Ms. Stoddard says that she had voluntary for missions throughout her career. "Sometimes I liked what I was doing, sometimes not," she said. "But at least, I knew that I had experienced this work and that I could scratch this area from the list of things to do."

Above all, she insists on the fact of establishing relationships. "To succeed, people have to know you, that they know what you know, what are your interests and your abilities. This is how I have evolved in businesses. This is how I built a network. And now I am at Adobe".

Title: How to transform your old Kindle into a super open-sound reader ...
Description:
There was a time when I felt that it was my divine right to access all the computers I wanted, to break all DRMs, and to unravel all the figures.

Receive a selection of strategic advice and concrete tips every week in your mailbox with our newsletter practical guides. Learn more about the use of personal data

When my wife's Kindle DX found himself blocked by planned obsolescence, I therefore felt a little shiver of excitement at the idea of ​​facing Dark Bezos.

The idea was of Jailbreaker the Kindle so that she could again read her favorite books on this very comfortable large format reader.

Jailbreaker with care

Be careful, it's a very bad idea, for example, to jailbreaker your phone. According to a study published this month, rooted Android devices (jailbreake) are the subject of 3.5 times more malicious software attacks. System compromises caused by rooted devices that pass the firewall of a company are much worse. These attacks are 250 times more numerous than for non -rooted devices.

Ancient Kindles, like the DX, are obsolete precisely because they cannot maintain a network connection. The DX connected to Amazon via 3G networks, most of which were dismantled. Thus, all that the jailbreaking has on this device is to allow the reading of certain books.

Last year, my wife wanted to do a spring cleaning on her DX. She therefore reset her by thinking that she could download her library again. But since she could no longer get a network connection, she could not record the device. Therefore, she was unable to charge any book on the device.

Rather than throwing the device, know that it is possible to "jailbreaker" and add an open source electronic book reading software. This can give him additional years of life.

In this article, I will explain to you how the Kindle Dx jailbrox. Each device has somewhat different methodologies. So use this article as a guide for the general approach. Unless you also have a DX, you will need to carry out your own research and readings for other readers.

Which Kindle do you have?

The starting point for this whole process is to identify the Kindle model with which you work and the firmware (firmware) currently installed on the Kindle. You can find both in the Settings menu of your Kindle.

Screenshot by David Gewirtz/ZDNET

My serial number begins with B009 and I use the firmware 2.5.8. With this information, you can go to the Wiki page of Kindle standard numbers, find the prefix of your serial number, then the code of your pseudo Kindle. In my case, B009 indicates that I use a graphite Kindle DX, known as DXG.

Screenshot by David Gewirtz/ZDNET

This will help you determine where to start your jailbreak process. If you have a more modern Kindle, go to the Jailbreak page on the mobileread forums. As I work with a much older Kindle DX, I start with a specific discussion thread on the DX jailbreak.

Depending on the device you have, you will have to look for instructions and files. As I use the DX, this is the path I will follow here.

How kailbreaker your kindle

The process is a bit like looking for pieces of a treasure card. You start with an index and follow it for a while, then you branch off by following another clue. In our case, clues are messages posted on discussion forums. Treasure pieces are the files related to these forums.

And, yes, this is a somewhat risky process. You will download unbenaged files from random forums on the Internet. Anything can be attached as a payload. The only positive point is that these forums are very populated and that the messages pinned are regularly updated, which makes it possible to hope that the Jailbreak community will find and expose any unavailable payload.

The next step was to go to the file page for versions 2.X, 3.X and 4.X of the firmware. I downloaded the Kindle-Jailbreak-0.13.n.zip file on my PC.

Screenshot by David Gewirtz/ZDNET

I then decompressed this zip file from Jailbreak and found a different jailbreak files, each being intended for a specific configuration.

Screenshot by David Gewirtz/ZDNET

Then, I connected a micro USB cable to my Kindle DX and I connected it to my PC. My Kindle then got into USB key mode.

Screenshot by David Gewirtz/ZDNET

I opened the Kindle reader from Windows and dragged the Update_jailbreak_0.13.n_dxg_install.bin file in the root directory of my Kindle.

Screenshot by David Gewirtz/ZDNET

Note that I specifically chose the version with "DXG". This brings us back to our first step, where I found the nickname my Kindle nickname. It was DXG, so I installed the dxg_install_bin file.

The next step is to perform the update. To do this, you must first eject and disconnect the Kindle from the PC. I pressed the Kindle DX physical menu button, then I selected update your Kindle.

Screenshot by David Gewirtz/ZDNET

This is where things become a little bizarre. Okay, it was already weird from the start, but this time, it was a little more worrying. First, the Kindle updates.

Screenshot by David Gewirtz/ZDNET

Then, once the update is finished, the Kindle reported a failure, with a small U006 error in the lower left corner of the screen. Fortunately, the instructions of Jailbreak specify that "it is completely normal, wanted and harmless".

So, yes, trust the process.

Install the Mobileread Kindlet kit

Then I had to install an MKK file (Mobileread Kindlet Kit), which seems to install a sort of developer certificate. This is documented on this page, and will redirect you to another page to find the file and download it.

I downloaded the MKK zip file and extract its content.

Screenshot by David Gewirtz/ZDNET

Once again, the repertoire contained a binary -dxg-, which I therefore downloaded on my Kindle DX. Then I ejected my Kindle and launched the Update Your Kindle process. It took a few minutes and a few manipulations for the Update Your Kindle option to appear.

I ended up restarting the Kindle, navigating up to settings, then pressing menu. The update option has then displayed and I chose it.

This time, the Kindle said that the update was successful.

Install Launchpad to test the jailbreak

There are two launchers available for jailbreake Kindles.

One is Launchpad, which works on the old Kindles.

The other is called KUAL (Kindle Unified Application Launcher).

Launchpad uses Kindle's keys to launch applications. KUAL uses a graphical interface to launch applications.

Kual works on the DX, but it is a little difficult to install, especially in this stage, I had not yet confirmed that the jailbreak really worked.

Launchpad settles down quite easily, and I only used it as a quick way to confirm that I could add applications to the Kindle and execute them.

So I installed Launchpad.

According to a scheme that becomes usual, I downloaded the Launchpad Zip File and I decompressed it. Then I found the bin file appropriate and I downloaded it in the root directory of my Kindle. I accessed Settings, then to Menu, and I launched Update Your Kindle.

Launchpad contains a large number of predefined keys sequences. Once the Kindle is mounted as a reader, you can go to the Launchpad repertoire and watch the content of servicecmds.ini. One of these commands is Shift S, which puts your Kindle in screen saving mode.

Test the operation of Launchpad

To test the operation of Launchpad, eject the Kindle of your computer. Then, on the Kindle, press the uppercase twice, then on the S key, all in quick succession. A small "success" message should be displayed in the lower left corner of the screen and the Kindle should go into standby mode (by displaying one of its famous graphics).

When it worked for me, it indicated that many things worked. This meant that the main jailbreak had succeeded because I was able to execute an additional application which was not that of Amazon. And that meant that I could execute localized orders, even if the interface is a bit clumsy.

Where this tool is quite powerful is that it allows you to define shortcut keys that run scripts on your Kindle. This goes beyond this article, but go to the Launchpad directory at the root of your Kindle device and read the Readme file. It will help you start if you want to configure keyboard shortcuts.

Install KUAL to launch applications

It is now time to install KUAL (Kindle Unified Application Launcher). It is available on the Mobileread Snapshots page. I downloaded the first Tar file from Kual and I extracted the files.

The installation of KUAL is different from the one I carried out previously. The Readme file describes different procedures according to the Kindle you use. For my former Kindle DX, I put the Kindle back in USB key mode and I dragged the KUAL-KDK-1.0.AZW2 file in the Kindle Documents folder.

Kual thus appears as a book on the home page. Just click on it to throw it. And no, I don't know what these letters mean to the right of the name.

Screenshot by David Gewirtz/ZDNET

Unfortunately, I encountered a problem, as shown in the screenshot below.

Screenshot by David Gewirtz/ZDNET

To solve this problem, I read this forum message and I downloaded this correction of the time and date of one of the forum users. This is an update file, so decompress it, slide the bin file corresponding to your device in the root folder of the mounting Kindle, eject the Kindle and run Update Your Kindle (update of your Kindle).

The different Kindle models can encounter different but similar problems. The file whose link is above only concerns Kindle DX models. If you encounter the same problem with another device, do what I did: glue the error message in Google with the "Kual" channel and start the treasure hunt.

Once the update process has been completed, a click on Kual made it possible to display a screen containing only KUAL. Here's what it looks like after installing the Koreader electronic book reader.

Screenshot by David Gewirtz/ZDNET

Install Koreader

Koreader is a very customizable electronic book reader that supports EPUB, PDF, DJVU, XPS, CBT, CBZ, FB2, PDB, TXT, HTML, RTF, DOC, Mobi and Zip. Let's start with the installation.

There are four different versions of Koreader for the Kindle. To find out which version corresponds to your device, see this page. As I use the Kindle DX, I downloaded the Legacy version from the Koreader distribution page.

The installation consists of decompressing the distribution file, then dragging the Koreader folder to the root of the Kindle, the content of the Launchpad folder in the Launchpad folder of the Kindle and the content of the extensions folder in the Kindle Extensions folder.

Once it is done, just throw Kual, wait a while, then click on Koreader.

Screenshot by David Gewirtz/ZDNET

It takes a few minutes to get used to the interface, and navigation is slow enough on the Kindle DX. That said, leaps from the page are not terrible and the reading experience seems just as pleasant as when the DX was able to download and display the Kindle books.

A new life for old electronic devices

I spent a few hours to urge insults during this operation. But now I have a device that works again.

A big thank you to the dedicated coders and the members of the forum who have developed and documented these jailbreaks for the benefit of the Kindle community.

Title: SoftBank will invest massively across the Atlantic in factories ...
Description:
According to the Nihon Keizai Shimbun (Nikkei), the Japanese group Softbank is considering investing $ 1,000 billion to build industrial parks in the United States using robots and artificial intelligence (AI).

All tech news for pros every day in our newsletter learn more about the use of personal data

Masayoshi Son, president of SoftBank Group, is expected to go to the United States soon to present to the US government this project for which he will seek direct funding from investment funds and financial institutions.

A response to Donald Trump's trade war

This is a response to the threat of American president Donald Trump to impose customs duties on other countries.

The industrial park envisaged by SoftBank will be equipped with systems using AI to provide demand in response to the decrease in labor. The idea is to optimize the design of production processes.

"The company will use AI in the production process of a wide range of products, including smartphones, cars and air conditioners, in order to modify (the process) so as to reduce human involvement," explains the Nikkei.

Previously, in January, SoftBank unveiled the Stargate project, a joint venture with Openai and Oracle to build data centers in the United States. He plans to invest up to $ 500 billion over the next four years.

Title: Morphing Meerkat: Phaas imitates brands and steals login data
Description:
Infoblox has exposed a phishing-as-a-service platform that uses DNS-Mail Exchange Records to imitate login pages of more than 100 brands.

As soon as a victim clicks on a phishing link, the phishing kit asks the MX Record of the victim's email domain to determine the service provider used. On this basis, a fake login page is generated in real time, which is deceptively based on the actual registration portal of the respective provider. The special feature: Morphing Meerkat uses configurations that are actually intended for other, legitimate purposes as the basis for personalized phishing attacks. It is a kind of "living-off-the-country" technique in the DNS version, in which attackers cleverly lean on existing IT infrastructures to stay under the radar.

Morphing Meerkat offers cybercriminal series of possibilities

Theft of login data

Once a victim has entered his login data on the fake page, Morphing Meerkat steals this data and sends it to the cybercriminals.

Diversions

In order not to suspect, the phishing kit forwards the victims to the real registration page of the mail provider after some failed login attempts.

Global range

The phishing kit can translate the fake login pages into numerous languages ​​and thus target users around the world.

Individualized traps

The attack is particularly convincing by the dynamic adjustment of the fake page based on the MX Record.

Veiling

The platform uses various techniques to avoid traditional security systems and not be recognized. These include open redirects on Adtech servers and the disguise of code to make the analysis difficult.

Scalability

As a Phaas platform, morphing meave also enables technically less experienced attackers to start large-scale phishing campaigns and thus present a massive threat.

If cybercriminals through a phishing scam such as Morphing Meerkat get into the possession of login data, this can have dramatic consequences, especially for companies. With these potentially, attackers are given access to networking, sensitive data and systems - and can start further attacks from the corporate environment. This can lead to enormous financial damage, loss of reputation and legal consequences for companies. In addition, attackers can specifically send phishing emails to employees or customers via compromised accounts-and thus continue their attacks even more efficiently and cause far-reaching damage.

Organizations can protect themselves against this type of attacks by improving the protection of their DNS. This includes a stricter DNS check so that users cannot communicate with DOH servers. Blocking access to Adtech and File Haring infrastructure that is not required for business can also be a sensible approach. Because if you consistently remove unnecessary services from the network, you remove the basis for many of your gate.

Title: In 2025, global gene ki editions are expected to increase to $ 644 billion
Description:
The global expenditure for generative artificial intelligence (Genki) is expected to reach $ 644 billion in 2025. This corresponds to an increase of 76.4 percent compared to 2024. This emerges from a current forecast of Gartner's market researchers.

"The expectations of Genai's performance are currently falling, since many first feasibility studies fail and the results so far often do not convince," said John-David Lovelock, Distinguished VP Analyst at Gartner. "Nevertheless, providers of basic models invest billions of billions every year in order to further improve the size, performance and reliability of their Genki models. This voltage ratio will also accompany us in 2025 and 2026."

The expenses for Genki should grow significantly this year in all core markets and partial markets. In the area of ​​IT services, partner assumes an increase of 162.6 percent to $ 27.76 billion. Expenditures for generative AI in the area of ​​software are expected to increase by 93.9 percent to $ 37.16 billion. Expenditures in the server area should amount to $ 180.6 billion, 33 percent more than in 2024.

For the Devices category, the largest sub -market, Gartner predicts an increase of 99.5 percent to $ 398.3 billion. "The growth trend of the market is strongly influenced by the increasing spread of AI-enabled devices, which should almost make up the entire market for consumer devices by 2028," continued Lovelock. "However, consumers are not behind these functions. If the manufacturers are incorporating AI into consumer devices as the standard function, consumers will be forced to buy them."

Title: Phishing attackers are increasingly relying on Russian 'bullet proof' domains
Description:
These domains are operated by 'Bullet-Proof' domain hosts. You are known to have reported malicious websites that are misused for phishing attacks and to ignore and ignore abuse reports. For 2025, the researchers expect a further increase in the use of such domains for phishing attacks.

The main goal of the attackers seems to be the collecting of Microsoft credentials. Links and QR codes are sent by email to lure victims to a fake-microsoft landing page, on which they should then enter their registration data. In order to avoid a quick discovery, the attackers send the links and QR codes via email attachments. Deriance links, often embedded in multi-layered HTML attachments, as well as polymorphic and dynamically generated URLs, an early detection also difficult.

Takedown largely excluded

But even if it succeeds in recognizing an attack, a rapid takedown is largely excluded, since the fake websites and emails are operated via 'Bullet Proof' domains. Abuse reports are often deliberately ignored here by the providers. As a rule, they have their homeland in states in which the laws on cyber crime are only weakly developed or simply not enforced. The result: attackers can initiate large -scale attack campaigns from here and bring minimal disorders to a successful conclusion.

As part of their almost two-month investigations, the researchers from Knowbe4 were able to assign the campaign to around 1,500. 377 of these domains were registered with the 'Bullet Proof' registration office R01-RU alone. More than 13,000 malignant emails were sent from here. 2.2 percent of the observed emails from .ru domains were phishing emails. The frightening: Many of the identified and analyzed phishing emails had successfully overcome professional email security solutions, such as the Exchange Online Protection, Barracuda Email Security Gateway, Mimecast and Cisco Ironport.

Risk factor human

The examination of the knowbe4 Threat Labs shows that simple anti-phishing tools and training courses are no longer sufficient to recognize attacks that target people as a risk factor in good time and ward off successfully. Companies must take a comprehensive view of the risks to which corporate IT is exposed to by their own employees. Phishing training, training and tests with AI have long been personalized, tailored to the individual weaknesses of each individual employee, and automatically used.

Title: "ChatGPT Team" adds powerful new features that utilize internal data
Description:
ChatGPT Team users who want to use ChatGPT using internal data will be able to do so with the new beta program that begins this time.

OpenAI product leader Nate Gonzalez announced in a post on LinkedIn on March 27th, US time that he will release the new feature, which was most requested by business users of ChatGPT. This feature allows ChatGPT to connect to internal knowledge sources. This means that employees can ask ChatGPT to answer questions, provide summary, and generate content for files stored by companies within the company.

The first source of information will be Google Drive, which will be available to use, and will be responding gradually over the next few weeks. Once it becomes available, you will receive a notification to your internal ChatGPT operation administrator that it can now be set up. Once set up, you will be able to connect to the Google Drive storage you use internally, and ChatGPT can look up files and provide the information and assistance you need.

Google Drive is just the first source of information available. Gonzalez said OpenAI plans to introduce more connectivity capabilities. He did not give a specific name, but he listed several categories. This feature will also be available to ChatGPT Enterprise users soon.

Gonzalez said: "This is just the beginning. The team is already working on a second installment of connectivity features, aiming to accommodate all of the key internal knowledge sources that users currently use, including collaboration tools, project management tools, data analytics platforms, and customer relationship management (CRM). These new connectivity features will soon be available for ChatGPT Team and ChatGPT Enterprise users."

At $25 per user per month, ChatGPT Team is aimed at any group that wants to share ChatGPT, which can be entirely or within the company. In contrast, ChatGPT Enterprise is for large businesses with over 150 employees, and fees are determined by the requirements of each company.

Privacy and security are always a concern when you have your company's sensitive data used by AI. Gonzalez emphasized that ChatGPT Team has security and privacy management capabilities that can be managed by operational administrators. It also states that OpenAI does not train models using data from ChatGPT Team and ChatGPT Enterprise accounts.

Title: Unmanned store, should I buy it right away? Will you go home as is? --The interpretation from leading companies
Description:
With the growing labor shortage and the spread of cashless payments, unmanned/manned stores are expanding. In this article, we will explain the mechanisms, benefits, and challenges of various unmanned stores, while experiencing the unmanned store systems developed by TOUCH TO GO (TTG) and NTT Data.

Unmanned stores can be broadly divided into "self-checkout" types, where customers scan and pay for products without the need for store staff; "walkthrough types" types, where customers automatically make payments when they pick up the product and leave the store; and "vending machine types", which allow you to operate around the clock without staff. The common benefits are stable store management with no-managers/small people and improved convenience for customers.

The core elements of realizing self-checkout/walkthrough stores are the AI ​​camera on the ceiling and the weight sensor on the product shelf. In many cases, the AI ​​camera on the ceiling captures the movement of customers, and the weight sensor on the shelf that it picks up, linking two types of data to recognize "who took what" in real time.

Self-checkout store where you can shop by passing by

TTG, which operates an unmanned payment store system, has steadily increased the number of stores introduced in 2020, starting with the opening of TOUCH TO GO Takanawa Gateway Station Store (Minato-ku, Tokyo), and is a leading figure in the spread of self-checkout stores. FamilyMart utilizes its unmanned payment store system, and as of September 2024, it has 44 unmanned payment convenience stores nationwide.



Takanawa Gateway Station Store. Takanawa Gateway Station store has a cash register near the exit. There is a cash register near the exit

Stores that have introduced TTG's unmanned payment store system, which is characterized by the fact that visitors do not need to prepare to register as a member when they enter the store, allowing them to enter and pay by passing by. The AI ​​camera and weight sensors can recognize who took what, so there is no need to scan the product barcode at checkout. When a customer stands in front of the register, the product details and total amount are displayed on the display screen.

Since many self-checkout stores allow you to enter the store on your way by passing by, it is believed to go well with stores such as stations where you often stop by. In fact, TTG's unmanned payment store system is used at unmanned stores selling souvenirs on the Tokaido Shinkansen platforms 16 and 17, as well as at take-out stores for Mister Donuts at the commercial facility Atre Shinanomachi. Although there is still an accounting process, it can be said that the reality is that it is aimed at unmanned/maintenance in stores due to the convenience and convenience of purchasing.
